etymologies: late 19th century: from French morphème, from Greek morphē ‘form’, on the pattern of French phonème ‘phoneme’

definitions: a meaningful morphological unit of a language that cannot be further divided (e.g. in, come, -ing, forming incoming).
shortDefinitions: meaningful morphological unit of language that cannot be further divided

definitions: a morphological element considered with respect to its functional relations in a linguistic system.
shortDefinitions: morphological element considered in respect of its functional relations in linguistic system
